values:
Been a while. I think I've gotten over a lot of things and maybe even grown up some in the past months. You know, life is hard and has a lot of heartache and disappointment, not to mention haunting memories. Things hurt. I always wanted to be better than that, always wanted to appear invincible, incapable of effect. It only really made it worse, I think. I was tortured more, showed it more, and hated myself more. A lot of very shitty and terrible things have happened around me, because of me, and to me in my life. I've made very poor choices and done things that I don't ever expect to be forgiven for. Sometimes I'm still haunted by these. Not as much and not as badly, though. 

I don't feel as special or better than everyone else. In a way, I did for a long time. That's what made it worse, I think. I don't expect anything at all anymore. Still, maybe I should. My life is probably at least 1/3rd ended by this point. It seems very long and very short at the same time. At any rate, we're destined to a fate undecided. Come what may..
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/15076.html

I had a dream, more or less, about the tall building in Seattle. I forget what it's called at the moment, but instead of shops or whatever at the top, there were apartments and such. Someone in my family, or even most of my family were moving in there. It wasn't the same "building", but it was one just like it. I was freaking out the whole time. Mostly, my family was just hanging out outside the apartments, where there were no guardrails or boundaries to protect anyone from the edge. Everyone was fine and comfortable just sitting outside smoking. I was on edge and freaking out, wanting to get everyone down and out of there. I had a bad feeling about the whole thing.

Here's where my dreams are different from probably 90% of other people's: I dream multi-scenario, multi-outcome, etc. In this dream, one of the ordeals was my cousin falling over the side, me grabbing him and hanging over the ledge myself before returning ourselves, presumably, back on top. I say "presumably", because that scenario didn't play all the way out. I was in the process of helping my cousin back onto the "floor", I guess, and that's all I recall. The other ordeal was actually trying to get them to leave. I think I got two family members to go down the elevator and out with me(and I freaked the whole time in the elevator, too). I think I did, but it might have just been me. In any case, the whole structure collapsed, and I recall wishing I had died, or would die, too. That was it really. I'm very afraid of heights, and the whole thing was odd because my mother is too, but she was one of the most comfortable and was the foremost in putting me down for wanting to get out.
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/14608.html

When and why did everything online become so messed up? I used to have friends worth talking to, things worth saying, etc. It's just not fun anymore. It hasn't been fun for a long time. I became more attached to a person on the internet than the internet itself a long time ago. She became my primary reason for getting online and it was never the same after that. So the internet started it, so the internet ended it. At least, in part. As it turns out, she lied to me and I should have been smart enough to completely remove her and never speak to her again, but that's not who I am. I DID love her and I continued to love her, but she didn't even apologize. She never did. She never even acknowledged any guilt or showed any remorse, not just for me, but for the other guy. He was a good guy, despite my ill feelings towards him when it came to her. I realized, in retrospect, that we were both under the same illusion, and though I was the ultimate choice, it didn't make me feel better for the fact that she had played on both of our emotions and used us. Her primary concern was removing herself from her parents' control, rather than any feelings toward either of us. Somehow, it never really hit me like it has in these past few months. He spent his own money to travel to see her, under the delusion that she felt the same about him as he felt of her, while she was "with" me. A few months later, she spent the money necessary to travel here. I feel very bad and have tried on separate occasions to seek him out to apologize to him. It doesn't matter so much, I'm sure, but things like that matter to me. 

Somehow, this was saved a few months back when I was ranting about shit and saved up til now. She was driving me kind of insane for all the lies, half-truths, etc. that I had in my head and couldn't sort out at the time. I'm not really sure how I feel about her or any of that now. On the one hand, I can't imagine anything genuine about her and despise the very thought of her. That's mainly due to my idea of her validating things by distortion, if not blatant lies. On the other side of it, I loved her because I saw something special in her. Cliche and whatnot, but I can't really describe the many conversations or what I took from them that originally led me to that idea. Underneath it all and beyond it all, she really loved and cared. I don't know anymore, and I don't expect that it matters. The last I knew of her, she was full of hate, apathy, and indifference. After feeling the full brunt of those things, I don't know if I want her to die or to live and be someone special, as I once saw her. All I know is I was pissed when I was asked if I talked to her anymore a few weeks ago. I'm not sure how I'd react if she tried to talk to me again, actually. Incredulously and bitterly, would be one way, but probably not. I'd probably laugh, or be civil maybe. We won't really talk again though, as I could never talk to her more than impersonally anymore.
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/14398.html

<lj-template name="qotd" id="1787" lang="en_LJ" />

The last thing that made me cry was the movie "Schindler's List". Specifically, the end, where Liam Nieson breaks down crying when talking about the things he could have traded or sold to save more people. That moment will forever put him in the top 5 greatest actors of all time in my book. That is the most heartbreaking moment in cinema history, in my opinion. You can't top the significance and loss of real lives. Millions live because of Oskar Schindler, but he could have done more, should have done more.. Heartbreaking.
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/14202.html

So, I figured out my "hearing voices" thing just now. Generally, it happens when I'm really tired or I've been up for a long time. Also, it seems that I have to space out, lose focus, or something along those lines. Well, it turns out, I just hear echoes of voices and sounds from earlier in the day/since I've been awake. I haven't really talked to anyone or heard any sounds in the last day, outside of a single song on repeat and my anti-virus program telling me that it updated. I kind of unfocused for a minute and heard an echo of, "Virus database has been updated". I looked at the computer screen, and there was no display box, and thus no voice saying that. I can tell the difference, seeing as how my "echoes" are generally not as clear, but I checked anyway. So, yeah, I had suspected as much previously, but that's confirmation on the theory. It doesn't really happen often, though it has occurred more in the last month, as I haven't been able to sleep nearly as well/often. Nice to know I'm not insane, anyway. Well, outside of audible memories distorting and placing themselves in focus randomly, with no conceivable importance or conscious thought. Ah well. Whatever, I guess.

Yeah, so I found this again a while back and decided to check in and possibly start writing on here again. It's amazing how long this has been around. I know it's longer than the first post shows. There were quite a few entries deleted at one point in time and plenty of edits after that. I don't know anyone on here or who even checks these things anymore. 

Yeah, I editted away most of this. Almost forgot to add: I had a gash on my head when posting this. I think it has turned into a scar now.

I believe this issue is covered well in my relationship with my friends. You need commonalities, but you're not the same. I think I'd hate anyone who liked everything I do. It's one thing to indulge someone's interests, but it's another to disregard and disrespect them, as well. If I don't like something, I make it known, but my opinion isn't more important. I don't hate anyone or think worse of them for things they enjoy, so long as it's within a respectable spectrum, of course. I don't expect anyone to like everything I do, and it would feel weird if they did. I don't like everything anyone else does, either. I'm a tolerant person, altogether. I can laugh, make fun, or just endure, but my opinion of a person on their own isn't changed. If I share none of their musical tastes? Maybe that would matter. I tend to be all around the spectrum, so I don't often have that problem. I discover new things that I hadn't heard to appreciate, for the most part. People interest me in themselves. The interests they have will always correlate with some interest that I have. The only thing that could possibly corrode an opinion is the belief that it will remove you from a group/person by stating it. I don't tend to care about that unless it could hurt someone. I tell people what I think and what I believe so long as it won't hurt them or put them on a defensive and rage-induced spree. I don't like fighting and arguing. I really don't like it over opinions and simplicities that people enjoy to their own effect. 

If I don't like or enjoy something to the same effect as someone else, so what? I appreciate people for who they are. Even if I don't care either way about something, I care because someone I care about does. That's me. I don't have preconceived notions about what's right and what's not. I absolutely loathed all boy bands, but there was a song or two that came to my attention that I liked. I grew a fascination for my own ignorance, actually. I don't know everything I like and everything I don't. I don't judge anyone for knowing their own interests, though. They're no different than I am. Everyone gains a wider spectrum through other people. Someone who absolutely adores the Beatles is someone I don't think I could be with. It's not that I hate the Beatles(well, not completely), but just that I hate anyone with the ideal that they were the be all, end all. I don't think I have to worry about it too much, but I've known some insane Beatles fans my age. I'd rather die, methinks.

Thought the subject fit. It's actually the title of a Deftones song if you didn't know. So, on to the matters at hand. Hung out at Adam's tonight. Damn you Half-Life! You're longer than I remember! That's not really the story at all, though. Around 4AM Adam looked like he was falling asleep, so I decided to leave. It's cold as hell outside. Heat doesn't heat as instantly as I'd like. Takes about 10 minutes to even start to get warm. This is all side-track stuff. Anyway, the story is the drive itself. Nothing significant in any way, just the environment itself. This is the reason I love the night. Early morning hours, there's no one around at all. The whole world is dead. It was foggy as hell tonight and I saw very few vehicles. Basically, I drew a correlation between my drive home and life. Life is blurry like the fog made it appear tonight. Nothing is ever really clear. You have to get close to make things clear. That's more on people. You don't know them until you get close to them. Even then, how well do you know a person? Which, sort of, brings me to my next thought. We are alone on the highway of life. You can say, "But I'm with the love of my life", or whatever, but it doesn't change our solitude. Being with the love of your life can indeed reduce your loneliness. They're just along for the ride, though. Think of it this way; you're driving and they're the passenger. They can tell you where to go, but you're the one driving so you have to make the turns. That's probably a bad analogy, but it works in my head. I don't really know how to explain the thought any better. No matter what, though, we're all alone with ourselves every second of the day, having our own thoughts and making our own decisions. Something the love of your life only experiences with his/herself. I had to post this for something pessimistic-ish compared to the optimistic tone of the Vanilla Sky post. Enjoy.

Well, I think I downloaded the best CD ever. Cold's 13 Ways to Bleed On Stage. Every song that I have is awesome. Two of the songs, however, refuse to download for me at this point in time. I already had two of the songs from the CD and thought about downloading the rest for a long time and finally did tonight for the most part. My favorites, starting with absolute favorite, are No One, Just Got Wicked, Bleed, End of the World, It's All Good, She Said, Confession and then the others. Haven't found the sources to be able to hear Witch or Anti-Love Song yet, but they sound promising. Sick of Man and Outerspace are both alright. Same Drug and Send In the Clowns aren't as good, though, in my opinion. I'll save judgement for Witch and Anti-Love Song until after someone finally sends it to me. Alright, done for now. Going to leave the track order of the CD.

1.  Just Got Wicked
2.  She Said
3.  No One
4.  End of the World

6.  It's All Good

There it be. Enjoy if you so wish it.

Well, I just got done watching Vanilla Sky. Now that I've finally seen it, I think it might be the greatest movie ever. Self-awakening or realization is really the main focus of the movie. So, I'm going to give some thoughts that come to me from seeing it. Is this life real? Is it all just a dream? This thought has occurred before, but Vanilla Sky brought it up again. How do you know that it's all real? The mind is powerful enough to create its own alternate reality. This is how dreams come about. I've had plenty of dreams that seem even more real than life in some ways. In fact, it seems like my life is a dream somehow. There's a block in my life between childhood and now. Like I could've fallen asleep as a kid and dreamed my life up from then on. It seems like I matured fast, that one day I just woke up and I was a whole new person. This is the main thought I had at the end of the movie. Another one, just how Tom Cruise is in love with Penelope Cruz and doesn't think he has a chance with her, doesn't see her for months. ___________ and it turns out, she was in love with him as well. Coincidence like that is what life seems to be made up of. I think the number one cause of failure is yourself. There's always self-doubt. You can succeed at anything if you let yourself. Of course, the question becomes "how do you let yourself?". I don't really know the answer myself. My only words are this: don't let your fear or doubts hold you back. Simple in theory, but hard to put to practice. Really, why should we care? Embarrassment seems to be our main concern. I'm 20 right now. For most people, that's 1/4 of their life. We really don't live that long. Why care so much? Why get embarrassed? Go after the girl you want, do the things you like to do, just whatever. We just don't take the chance. I mean, asking a girl out or something. Good example. She laughs, turns you down, who cares? You're using the little time you have to achieve your own happiness. You don't live with her, so it's not going to have that much of an effect on you. Even if she is somewhat close to you, what's it matter? People laugh, they laugh. At least you're taking the risks to get what you want. Besides that, the people you really care about and are there at your funeral aren't going to make fun of you for such things. After all, risk-takers tend to be admired. Yeah, that was a long rant and probably too cheery and preachy. Anyway. The little things. Another thing talked about in the movie. We really do seem to take too much for granted. "The sweet isn't as sweet until you've had the sour". I think that was the quote in the movie. It sort of goes along with this topic. It's more along the lines of 'you don't know what you've got until it's gone' though. Just talking to someone, being able to listen, being able to see. These are things we really take for granted. It's something you never think about, but what would happen if you went blind? Any sight would be a blessing after that. There are people that would give anything to have one minute of sight or hearing. It's sad the lack of appreciation we have for such things. Then again, we couldn't function as well if we did. I think it's important to know the luck those of us who can see or hear have. Next time you see something beautiful, taking a second to think what it'd be like if you couldn't will make you appreciate it that much more. And with that, I think I'm done ranting. I think I went overboard with optimism, but those are how the thoughts occurred to me. Someone shoot me. 

Oh, and the _________ was so I didn't really ruin the movie.
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/10672.html

Well, as of now, I've been up for 30 hours. I think I'm going to sleep soon, though, since I think I want to go to TJ's later on and hang out. I woke up at 4am yesterday morning and have been up since. At around 11pm, I was thinking about sleeping and TJ called me. He asked me if I wanted to go over there and hang out. I wasn't really all that tired, so I told him I'd be over. Oh, and Adam was being a nigger I take it. He missed some good times, though. I ended up leaving to go over to TJ's at around midnight. Got over there and me, him and Buff went to Kendra's place to hang out. There weren't many people there at all(alright.. i dunno if this sentence is grammatically correct or not.. and honestly.. i dont really care). There was some drinking going down, but I'm not a drinker really. I like to drink a little bit every now and then, but since I was already up for so long and had to drive home later, I decided drinking wasn't a good idea. The mexican was over there. Crazy guy. Enough said. My eyes were all dried out pretty much the whole time, and still are now. Rundown of things that happened: John got sick for a little while, they got in the hottub, drank. The crazy things that happened: Well, I have to write more about this one. Basically, a cop possibly saw TJ pissing in Kendra's neighbor's yard. What's funny about this is 3 other people did before him. There was Buff twice, me, John and Ronald. TJ asked me where I pissed and I showed him. So I went back to sit down by the hottub(everyone was either inside or on a cigarette run besides us). Not even 20 seconds later, I hear TJ walk back and bump into a chair. He then tells me he thinks a cop may have spotted him. So, we go inside, inform them and close/lock the doors. The closing and locking of the doors was because John said he saw two cops out the window or something. I say that was kind of stupid, but it didn't really matter. Long story short, nothing came of it. No cop knocking on the door or anything. We think it was Kendra's neighbor, a cop, coming home from his shift. Not long after that, they get back with cigarettes and me and TJ go smoke. Ronald comes outside with a gash on his eyebrow. Apparently, he threw an ice cube at John, and John threw it back and actually hit him. The heavy stuff for the night was Buff. You can't help but feel bad for him. If shit went down and he got into a fight with one of those fuckers, I'd help him out. That is, if someone tried to jump in or whatever. I'm not really one to get into fights, but Buff is a cool dude. Anyway, we left at like 6 or something. Kendra drove us to TJ's(like.. two blocks away..) and I hung out over there for a while. Talked about music and shit. We also agreed that Buff and Kendra would be a good match. I left TJ's around 8 or so and went to Mama's. We love her. She made me a big ass pancake. And with all my sleep deprivation, I rambled on much like I have with this post. I came home and downloaded a few cool songs that I could remember from TJ's and now at 11:28am, I've survived 31.5 hours of sleep deprivation. I'm thinking I'm gonna sleep either now, or real soon. Oh, and the post took this long because I went in the living room and drew something for some odd reason. I guess I'm easily sidetracked and amused when tired. And with that, I think I'm gonna try to stop typing now.

I think you need to watch George Carlin to see why saying nigger, fuck, shit, etc. isn't necessarily bad. Of course, the way I said it most likely is. What can I say to that, though? Well, I decided to post this since I just had the thought. Been listening to some of my older music. It really brings back memories/feelings from when I originally was listening to the songs. Well, let's just say, I was quite the depressive music freak. Not necessarily in a bad way, just went with the times I guess. Some of it actually has a newer meaning for me as well as the old. In other news, things have happened. Big surprise there. Actually, I've been doing pretty much the same stuff over and over for a few months now. Pool at John's house, hanging out at TJ's or Adam's and playing some games/watching movies. Wow, my life is boring as hell. Ah well, death comes soon enough to liven up all our lives..(see what i did there.. i used life and death in support of each other.. which should be funny.. but it's not.. so screw all you bastards that laughed)

Well, I guess I'll post something since I haven't for so long. Nothing that new with me. Reinstalled Counter-Strike on the pc in the living room after playing Source at Andy's. Yeah, I hate you Andy. Been playing that some with bots on LAN and watching TV. Also been watching my Star Wars DVDs. Started watching the first two with commentary the other night. I already know every line in the movies, so commentary is something a little different. Yeah, I need new movies. And that's about it. Watching Lord of the Rings again now and going to sleep soon. By the way Andy and Pat, update your blogs! (yeah.. im a hypocrite)
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/9582.html

Well, I guess I can restart my journal shit here. Today we had Easter dinner at my gma's house. It was fun because we ended up playing hold'em poker for 5 hours or more. The first game, I won. After that, I did alright but not nearly as good. I've been playing poker on Party Poker since November or so about every night. I'm pretty good, I guess. I just play for fake money on there. I do wish it was real so I could cash out my 15 million, though. Another thing I've been getting into lately is pool. Started playing downstairs every day/every other day about a month ago. I'm not bad at that either. Only thing that sucked about today is I haven't slept for 26 hours. So, my eyes are kinda dry and I'm in a kind of daze of sorts. Watching Lord of the Rings: Fellowship of the Ring. I usually watch one of them before sleeping. I know all three of them by heart. I actually just go through the lines saying them as they come up in the movie. I've definately seen these movies too many times. I'd say I've watched them each at least 30 times. Probably more actually. Fellowship is my favorite by far. I think it's how they travel through the whole movie and the good fight scenes. They're smaller and better battles in my opinion. The big battles in Two Towers and Return of the King don't have as much of a focus point. Don't get me wrong, they're all very good, but Fellowship just has something that makes it better in my mind. The other day I had the idea that Peter Jackson should do The Hobbit. I just thought that would be cool. I've never read The Hobbit, but of course, I'm lazy. So go figure. Jackson making a movie of it would save me time and effort. Anyway, I'm dead. I wanna pass out for 15 hours. Peace.
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/9377.html
Well, I guess I might start posting on this again. It's all Andy's fault too. So, enjoy my stupid shit. Peace.
http://aerolight.livejournal.com/9026.html

Well, I had a repeat of a dream from a few months back the other night. It's something like a game. This time, it was something like Jedi Academy. I remember Darth Vader was one of the 'players'. Lightsabers and all, with some characters having their own special abilities. One of them can turn into animals. My 'team' always takes out everyong but him. I run, he changed into a tiger and chases me. We got to the same place in both dreams: this small section beside a house. I'll try to map it out.

---------------------------------------------------------------
|                        |
|                        |
|   |------|             |
|   |      |             |
|   |      |             |< house would end where this is.. 
|   |------|             |
|      ^                 |
|      wooden fence      |      
|                        |-------------------------------------
|
|--------------------------------------------------------------

Basically, I get to the fence and jump back and forth with the tiger doing the same behind me. I always wake up after jumping back and forth over the fence. It's strange and I know Jedi Academy had an affect on the dream this time. The first time it occured, I don't know what could have made me dream it. The first dream was longer, as well. There was a lot more area to cover. I remember old houses, trees, and a lot of bushes. There were bushes in the latest dream, too. They were around what seemed to be asphalt driveways I ran through to get to the fence. Ah well, weird stuff. Hopefully, this posts how it shows here. If it doesn't, the map isn't going to look right at all. In other news, mother went to town and I gave her money to get me the Star Wars Trilogy on DVD, but they didn't have it yet. It turns out, they don't come out til the 21st. Sucks to be me. Think I may get her to buy them for me so I can buy Star Wars: Battlefront with my money. I guess I'm going to do some things for her tomorrow or something to try and get her to do it for me. *crosses fingers*
What sucks in the DVD edition, they have the fucker who plays Anakin in episodes 2 and 3 at the end of Return of the Jedi as the 'ghost' with Obi-wan and Yoda. That's just bullshit. I hate that fucking kid. Besides, it looks better with all the older guys together, anyway. Obi-wan and Yoda look the same as they did when they died, yet, Vader magically transforms to his youthful appearence. What a bunch of bullshit. Ah well, I guess I can overlook that one if they make up for it with special features and such.

Dream I had was quite strange. I don't really remember how it started. I was walking with Matt behind this building. We were still in high school at this time by the way. There is no place at the high school like any of the places in my dream though. We were walking and Wooten was there and he went with us. We walked to this place that had been in a dream way back. It was this old run down building. In my previous dream, TJ's house was right on the other side of it. We got there and went inside. It was just as run down inside as out. There were many kids inside. I guess this place was where everyone went to skip class. I guess I questioned about it to some girls. That's basically what they told me. That, and that people come here to fight in this back room. I looked through the window on the door in the back and saw Whitt with blood on his face and another kid with blood on his face as well. I started to walk back to the entrance of the building and some guy looked in. He was older looking, grey hair but not facial hair. He had a feminine voice. I think I had saw this guy on TV before actually. He talked to Wooten and everyone had to leave. Told Wooten he had to clean it and fill out forms to turn in everyone who was there. Wooten said, "Alright, Mr. Moore". We all just left and went to the high school I guess. Inside, I was there sitting on a couch that was in the middle of the fork. Noah showed up. Others were around him and he said something about he bought 160 hamburgers(I think this was a reference to the past to tell why he was somewhat fat). I walked over to him and he opened this big case type thing. Those plastic case things with lids. Don't remember what it's called, but he opened it and had tons of chips and bread in it(no wrappers.. just the chips and bread itself). People started sticking their hands out, so he gave them some. Then he walked over to me so I stuck my hand out and he gave me some. That was the end of it. I now recall the beginning of the dream. We were in gym class. Me and Matt I guess. This kid wanted to fight Hudnal or TR(I know the kid, but dont remember his name.. preppy guy). I can't remember which. Neither of them wanted to fight at school, but someone cohersed the kid into fighting Hudnal/TR. He just punched him in the face once or twice and the teacher yelled and he stopped. Hudnal/TR didn't do anything at all. I guess they were both suspended on the spot because they both just walked out the door. I guess Matt and I followed. Hudnal/TR was pissed. He said that he was gonna beat the shit outta the kid. They both got in their cars and left. Another car showed up. It was Gaskins in a Mustang. He was driving wrecklessly, going everywhere. This is about the time that Matt and I started walking to that room. Gaskins drove up behind us fast, we moved out of the way. There was a line of people going to the room up ahead. He drove to the right side of them. I then saw Megan Tibbits in the passenger seat before he sped around them. I told Matt that I hope they hit the fence. Gaskins was driving turning all the time and he did end up turning to the right and hitting the fence. It was chainlink, so it didn't do much damage. He backed out then came towards us before turning to the left(his right) and going out on the road and away from the school. The road was between two buildings that we were walking behind. Buildings on our left and the chainlink fence to our right. The dream continued from there.

I always forget the beginning of my dreams until I start writing down what I do remember. When I'm around the middle of it, the beginning always comes back to me.
